title: How to Get Rid of Camel Toe in Jeans, Leggings, & More

steps.title: Wear pants that are the proper size.
steps.content: Wear pants that are the proper size. Whether you’re wearing jeans, leggings, or other pants, one of the easiest ways to prevent camel toe is to make sure they aren’t too tight. Try your pants on to make sure you can move and sit comfortably in them, especially in the crotch area. Remember that it’s normal for weight to fluctuate, so don’t stress if you need to size up from what you normally wear. [1] X Research source Consider the rise of your jeans as well. Some people experience camel toe more often if they wear high-waisted jeans or pants. This applies to swimwear, as well. Too-small swimsuit bottoms are especially prone to camel toe. Note that wearing leggings that are too loose can also cause camel toe, as the excess material may bunch up around your crotch.

steps.title: Choose loose, breathable fabrics.
steps.content: Choose loose, breathable fabrics. Camel toe is likely to be worse when wearing stretchy, synthetic materials like yoga pants or other workout gear. Opt for more breathable fabrics whenever possible, and buy clothing (especially workout clothing) that has built-in lining at the crotch. This extra layer will help reduce the appearance of camel toe. [2] X Research source To avoid camel toe, it’s usually best to stay away from 100% Spandex. Avoid linen and polyester fabrics, as well, especially if it’s warm out.

steps.title: Wear underwear.
steps.content: Wear underwear. If you want to avoid camel toe, don’t go commando; going without underwear will increase the chances you’ll have this problem, especially if you’re wearing pants made of thin, stretchy material or light-colored fabric. For even better results, go for low-rise panties , seamless underwear , or underwear with a crotch lining . [3] X Research source Wearing thicker panties is less likely to cause camel toe because they won’t get pulled into your private parts as easily. Thicker panties also provide some support and help smooth out lines.

steps.title: Go for leggings or pants made of thick fabrics.
steps.content: Go for leggings or pants made of thick fabrics. Thinner materials have less of a barrier between your skin and tend to emphasize the crotch area as the fabric can easily fold around your labia. To prevent this, choose thicker leggings or yoga pants that are opaque and matte enough that you can’t see your underwear through them. [4] X Research source Don’t wear tights as leggings, as they’re especially see-through. If you’re wearing leggings as pants, consider wearing a long shirt, sweater, or tunic for extra protection. Shapewear leggings can also help, as they work to smooth bulges and unevenness in the stomach, legs, and the area in between.

steps.title: Opt for dark colors or patterned fabrics.
steps.content: Opt for dark colors or patterned fabrics. Black and dark colors help hide certain parts of your body, including your camel toe, so choosing dark colors is especially helpful if you want to wear leggings or other tight-fitting bottoms. Similarly, some patterns can “confuse” the eye and help disguise camel toe. [5] X Research source Fashion expert Melissa Young agrees that thin, unsupported polyester or yoga pants in a light color are the worst possible fabrics for camel toe. White and light beige fabrics often leave nothing to the imagination, especially with non-tailored yoga pants or other stretchy fabrics. This is why it’s best to avoid them if you want to prevent or hide camel toe.

steps.title: Wear leggings with liners or gussets.
steps.content: Wear leggings with liners or gussets. Leggings with a reinforced gusset, like leakproof leggings , have extra material around the crotch to reduce friction and cushion the area. This extra material often helps prevent camel toe, as it is thicker than normal legging material. Additionally, leggings with gussets typically have an oval- or diamond-shaped seam rather than a straight seam, which can also help reduce the appearance of camel toe. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Put on a panty liner.
steps.content: Put on a panty liner. Wearing a panty liner is a quick fix if you know your pants give you a camel toe or if you’ve already left the house once you realize it. Simply stick the panty liner to your underwear as you normally would to conceal creasing. The thick material should prevent your bottoms from bunching up around your crotch. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Consider wearing cycling underwear.
steps.content: Consider wearing cycling underwear. Cycling underwear is made of thick material with sewn-in foam pads to reduce friction and soreness when riding a bike. The extra padding helps prevent camel toe when you wear leggings, bike shorts, or other tight pants. Alternatively, look for bike shorts with built-in chamois if you typically wear bike shorts more than leggings. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Buy special camel toe inserts or panties.
steps.content: Buy special camel toe inserts or panties. These days, there are many products available to help prevent or reduce the appearance of camel toe. Buy commercial inserts that resemble panty liners, or order special panties designed to prevent camel toe. There are also commercial camel toe guards available that resemble men’s athletic cups. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Cut up a bra cup pad and stick it in your underwear.
steps.content: Cut up a bra cup pad and stick it in your underwear. If you need a quick DIY hack to hide your camel toe, find a bra cup pad you no longer use and cut it into a triangle small enough to fit in the liner or pocket of your panties. Slip it inside the pocket for some extra padding when you wear pants that give you a camel toe. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Camel toe is when the outline of the vulva is visible in tight-fitting clothes.
steps.content: Camel toe is when the outline of the vulva is visible in tight-fitting clothes. A camel toe, or a frontal wedgie, refers to when your pants are too tight and you can see the outline of the lips of your vulva through them. It mainly happens when you wear tight jeans, leggings , swimsuits, or athletic clothing. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Clothing that is too small or tight
steps.content: Clothing that is too small or tight The most common cause of camel toe is wearing jeans, leggings, yoga pants, or other bottoms that are too tight, especially in the crotch area. These pants will cling to your body and make your camel toe more noticeable. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Clingy clothing fabric
steps.content: Clingy clothing fabric Certain clothing materials and styles are more likely to cause camel toe than others. Fabrics that cling to each other or to your body often mold to the shape of your pelvic area and lead to camel toe. This includes fabrics like polyester and other synthetic workout material, as well as cotton underwear. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Your natural body shape
steps.content: Your natural body shape While wearing certain clothing can make your camel toe more noticeable, it’s important to understand that this is just how the female body is shaped. Because everyone’s body is different, some people may have more issues with camel toe than others. Shaving your bikini area can also sometimes make your camel toe more prominent.

steps.title: Camel toe may cause discomfort.
steps.content: Camel toe may cause discomfort. If you have a camel toe because your clothes are too tight, you may not feel too comfortable in the crotch area. It may feel as if your pants or leggings are riding up, squishing your genitals, or giving you a wedgie.

steps.title: Your clothes may lack breathability.
steps.content: Your clothes may lack breathability. If your clothes are tight enough to cause a camel toe, they may also be too tight for air to circulate within them. This can lead to dampness from crotch sweat, as well as unwanted odor. Wearing loose or sweat-wicking materials can help prevent this. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Your genitals may become irritated.
steps.content: Your genitals may become irritated. In general, you likely won’t experience much irritation from occasionally wearing clothes that give you a camel toe. However, if you wear too-tight clothing frequently, the friction and lack of breathability may irritate the skin, which can eventually lead to infection . [15] X Research source

steps.title: Camel toe is nothing to be embarrassed about.
steps.content: Camel toe is nothing to be embarrassed about. However, like cleavage or visible nipples, it is a very personal area, and it is up to you to decide what you are comfortable with revealing. Camel toe was once considered a fashion faux pas, but these days, some women choose to rock it intentionally. You should never feel embarrassed about your body, but if you prefer not to show camel toe, try one of the solutions in this article to prevent it.
